Class GameLobbyEvent

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.ClientServer.Messages.GameLobbyEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Event
public class GameLobbyEvent extends Object implements Event
Represents an event for a game lobby, which includes the list of players and their readiness statuses. This event is part of the larger event interface hierarchy and can be processed by an EventVisitor. The purpose of this event is to encapsulate the state of the game lobby, specifically by providing the list of players currently in the lobby and a corresponding readiness status for each player. Constructors: - A default constructor for initialization without parameters. - A parameterized constructor allowing deserialization via JSON annotations to initialize the player list and readiness status. Implements: - Event interface, allowing the event to be visited by EventVisitor implementations. Methods: - Accepts a visitor to process this event as part of the visitor design pattern. - Returns a placeholder message. - Provides access to the list of players. - Provides access to the readiness statuses of the players.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLobbyEvent

      public GameLobbyEvent()
      Default constructor for the GameLobbyEvent class. This constructor initializes a new instance of the GameLobbyEvent, which represents an event for managing game lobby state. It can be used to define an empty event instance for initialization or deserialization purposes.

    • GameLobbyEvent

      public GameLobbyEvent(ArrayList<String> players, ArrayList<Boolean> ready)
      Constructs a GameLobbyEvent with the specified list of players and their readiness statuses.
      Parameters:
      players - the list of player names in the game lobby
      ready - the list of readiness statuses corresponding to the players; true if the player is ready, false otherwise

  • Method Details

    • accept

      public void accept(EventVisitor visitor)
      Allows the provided EventVisitor instance to process this GameLobbyEvent.
      Specified by:
      accept in interface Event
      Parameters:
      visitor - the EventVisitor instance that will process this GameLobbyEvent

    • message

      public String message()
      Retrieves the message associated with this event. This method is intended to provide a descriptive message relevant to the specific event. For this implementation, it returns an empty string.
      Specified by:
      message in interface Event
      Returns:
      a descriptive string representing the message of the event, or an empty string if no specific message is associated with this event.

    • getPlayers

      public ArrayList<String> getPlayers()
      Retrieves the list of players currently in the game lobby.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the names of the players in the lobby

    • getReady

      public ArrayList<Boolean> getReady()
      Retrieves the list of readiness statuses for players in the game lobby. Each element in the returned list corresponds to a player's readiness status, represented as a Boolean value where true indicates readiness and false indicates not ready.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Boolean values representing the readiness status of each player in the game lobby.
